metadata.title: CVE-2022-2867 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
libtiff's tiffcrop utility has a uint32_t underflow that can lead to out ofbounds read and write. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to tiffcrop(likely via tricking a user to run tiffcrop on it with certain parameters)could cause a crash or in some cases, further exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2867` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm3
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm3
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm3
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm3').
